responses.content:
Explanation: This form of argument is known as contrapositive reasoning, which is a valid form of logical reasoning. The original statement can be written in the form "P -> Q", where P represents "the meal was prepared" and Q represents "it was not prepared carefully". The contrapositive of this statement is "~Q -> ~P", which can be translated to "if the meal was prepared carefully, then it was not prepared". Since the argument follows the form of a valid logical argument (contrapositive), it is logically valid.
